intro: Guatteria atabapensis, commonly known as the Atabapensis Guatteria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly found in the Caribbean islands. The plant is characterized by its evergreen leaves, which are typically elliptical and have a glossy surface. It produces small, fragrant flowers that are usually white or pale yellow, arranged in clusters. Guatteria atabapensis is often found in humid, shaded environments such as tropical rainforests and forest understories.
